name: affair
content:
affair noun [C]
(MATTER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 a situation or subject that is being dealt with or considered: foreign affairs As a leader, he's been criticized for his inexperience in foreign affairs.interfere in someone's affairs He's always interfering in (= trying to influence) other people's affairs.financial affairs She organizes her financial affairs very efficiently. What I do in my spare time is my affair (= only involves me).
B2 a matter or situation that causes strong public feeling, usually of moral disapproval: The arms-dealing affair has severely damaged the reputation of the government. The president's handling of the affair has been criticized.
More examplesFewer examplesThe whole affair does not reflect well on the government.He put his affairs in order before he went into hospital.I've never been very money-minded - I leave all my business affairs to my financial adviser.The director has come in for a lot of criticism over his handling of the affair.
